intro: Dupatya laxifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a circular pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
